question_text: How would you design a highly scalable and cost-effective serverless architecture on GCP to process user-uploaded images, including resizing, watermarking, and storing metadata?
hook_text: Build a serverless image processing pipeline on Google Cloud that scales automatically and only pays for what it uses.
cta_text: Master serverless on GCP for your next interview. Follow for more cloud architecture deep dives!

answer_sections.title: Event-Driven Ingestion
answer_sections.text: User uploads image to Cloud Storage. Eventarc captures this event, triggering a Pub/Sub message. This cleanly decouples storage from processing workflows.

answer_sections.title: Serverless Processing
answer_sections.text: Pub/Sub triggers Cloud Functions for lightweight tasks, like metadata extraction. Complex image transformations, such as resizing and watermarking, utilize Cloud Run.

answer_sections.title: Data Persistence & Notifications
answer_sections.text: Processed images are saved to Cloud Storage. Image metadata, along with processing logs, persists in Firestore. Final events trigger user notifications.

diagrams.title: Image Ingestion Flow
diagrams.dsl:
(User) as user_node -> (Upload Image) as upload_node -> [Cloud Storage] as cloud_storage_node
[Cloud Storage] as cloud_storage_node --> "Object Finalized Event" (Eventarc) as eventarc_node
(Eventarc) as eventarc_node -> [Cloud Pub/Sub Topic] as pubsub_topic_node

diagrams.title: Processing with Functions & Run
diagrams.dsl:
[Cloud Pub/Sub Topic] as pubsub_topic_node_2 -> [Cloud Functions] as cloud_functions_node
[Cloud Pub/Sub Topic] as pubsub_topic_node_2 -> [Cloud Run Service] as cloud_run_node

diagrams.title: Storage & Notification
diagrams.dsl:
[Cloud Functions] as cf_processed -> [Cloud Storage (Processed)] as cs_processed
[Cloud Functions] as cf_processed -> [[Firestore (Metadata)]] as fs_metadata
[Cloud Run Service] as cr_processed -> [Cloud Storage (Processed)] as cs_processed_2
[Cloud Run Service] as cr_processed -> [[Firestore (Metadata)]] as fs_metadata_2
[Cloud Storage (Processed)] as cs_processed_3 --> "Processed Event" [Cloud Pub/Sub Topic (Notifications)] as pubsub_notifications

voiceover_script: User uploads an image to Cloud Storage. Eventarc captures this event, triggering a Pub/Sub message. This cleanly decouples storage from processing workflows. Pub/Sub then triggers Cloud Functions for lightweight tasks, like metadata extraction. Complex image transformations, such as resizing and watermarking, utilize Cloud Run. Finally, processed images are saved to Cloud Storage. Image metadata, along with processing logs, persists in Firestore. Final events then trigger user notifications.
